body_html:
@ngimel, yes I think that was there because of some code sharing via the torch.Tensor(ndarray) constructor which was intended to copy if the types didn't match.

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/v0.3.1/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp#L308-L316

We've promised the torch.from_numpy shares memory in the documentation and repeatedly in forum posts:
http://pytorch.org/docs/0.3.1/torch.html#torch.from_numpy

body:
@ngimel, yes I think that was there because of some code sharing via the `torch.Tensor(ndarray)` constructor which was intended to copy if the types didn't match.

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/v0.3.1/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp#L308-L316

We've promised the `torch.from_numpy` shares memory in the documentation and repeatedly in forum posts:
http://pytorch.org/docs/0.3.1/torch.html#torch.from_numpy
